page.title: 06Restored Buildings.
page.content: In{Redditch}we have tried to preserve as many old buildings as possible.{ {Marlfield Barn}in Church Hill which has been converted into Community Rooms is an example of this. The{Craft {Centre}in{Winyates}is a restored set of farm out-buildings. Here, pottery, leatherwork, needlecraft, jewellery and instrument making can be seen and purchased in the craft shop. The most impressive restored building is{Forge {Mill.}It is the world's only water driven needle scouring mill and has been restored to working order. In June 1983 H.R.H. Queen Elizabeth II opened the mill as the{National Needle {Museum.}It is a working museum which displays each stage of needle making. There is also a static display called "Thousands of uses for millions of needles". Redditch-made needles secure the tiles of N.A.S.A.'s space shuttle.
